intro: Spigelia anthelmia var. obliquinervia, commonly known as the narrow-veined spigelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, reddish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a distinct, narrow venation pattern. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
